channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16044] Fix 'hbase shell' output parsing in graceful_stop.sh
item.description:
In some of our bash scripts we are piping command in hbase shell and then parsing response to define variables. Since 'hbase shell' output format is changed we are picking wrong values from output Here is example form gracful_stop.sh:


HBASE_BALANCER_STATE=$(echo 'balance_switch false' | "$bin"/hbase --config "${HBASE_CONF_DIR}" shell | tail -3 | head -1)

this will return "balance_switch true" instead of previous balancer state.
item.summary: Fix 'hbase shell' output parsing in graceful_stop.sh

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Which issue changed this on you Samir Ahmic?

I think it was HBASE-15849 by adding this line:


+        formatter.output_str("Took %.4f seconds" % [@end_time - @start_time])

It is simple fix in graceful_stop.sh and rolling-restart.sh just "tail -2" instead fo "tail -3".

I did a bunch of refactoring recently. But looking around, I don't see why the output will change. But here's my thought:
OMG, what are we doing in these scripts!
| tail -3 | head -1
Exactly the 3rd line from the bottom of an interactive shell output, which should basically be free-form and no-one should depend on it. Really? Hack level = max. Such a thing is bound to break.
Appy Can we restore the output to what it was? Others than Samir Ahmic probably rely on a particular output?

Btw, the change is that previously we outputted 'x rows in y seconds' in single line. But now, it's split in two lines (because of refactoring time keeping logic to commands.rb). This increases one line. So changing to {{tail -4 }} should put a bandage on it.
Better would be to remove this hack by showing all output of the command.

Sorry, didn't see your last comment.
I guess the users shouldn't rely on output format of an interactive shell. Bad practice to promote. That's why recently i made a little change in paradigm (which isn't perfect, but much much better). If the shell is run in non-interactive mode (-n), we should return underlying commands actual result (the one that doesn't go through formatter) in the end. At least that way, user scripts (not referring to ones in the /bin) don't depend on the way our formatter works. Otherwise imagin, adding a space in our core code (formatter.rb) breaking critical scripts of users. Really not a good place to be in.
Example : we return the list of peers in addition to formatting and outputting it to console above.
Then we drop/print the result depending on whether the shell is interactive or not. here.

Ping.
Sean Busbey what's your take?

generally, I think of hbase shell output as covered by our "operational compatibility" promise in the versions section of the ref guide: no breaking changes in maintenance releases, but minor and major versions are fair game.

While I agree that we should make sure our internal use is consistent (and probably relying on java classes instead of the overhead of jruby), I don't think our current operational tooling is at a place where we can expect folks not to build stuff on top of what comes out of the shell. Our other options are just too limited. We even added the --non-interactive flag to make this go easier for folks. Including output changes behind feature flags is still fine, IMO.

If nobody objects i will create ticket for creating simple java command line tool that will manage balancer states to avoid this type of bugs in future ? I have checked our scripts and we are parsing 'hbase shell' output only in graceful_stop.sh and rolling-restart.sh in order to manage balancer.
+1 thanks Samir!
Here is ticket for adding java based tool HBASE-16078

Since these changes are only in master and branch-1, i think it keeps our operational compat promise. stack, you still think we should change the format back? Or does the below plan sounds good?

At some point, we might want to define our guidelines more strictly, something like the following: (based on discussion with Sean)

  • non-interactive output: will keep operational compatibility across maintenance release. From our perspective, it'll basically dump the output from HBaseAdmin directly. (So in a way, it'll be like a admin client for shell).
  • interactive output: free-form and can change any time. The only good reason for this is, formatted shell output is like text-UI, and UI are not good for programatic interface. And think about it, what if we want to add a christmas easter egg in 2.0 .

Since these changes are only in master and branch-1, i think it keeps our operational compat promise. stack, you still think we should change the format back? Or does the below plan sounds good?

If the shell output changes are just in master and branch-1, then yeah I agree we're fine on compatibility. So the fix here would be to just update how we parse the output?

Show me Appy I'm thinking that for branch-1, yeah, no breaking format change because of what @busbey says above ("I don't think our current operational tooling is at a place ...."). Samir Ahmic is around this issue and is understanding but I'd guess there are others who are not and will be frustrated by this change. But show me....

Discussed with stack offline. I am fine with reverting the earlier changes (HBASE-15965 and HBASE-15849) from branch-1 even though they are within our operational compatibility guidelines. I think his concern for usability triumphs here, lets make minor release (if 1.4 does comes out) easier for users.
These two changes are not critical and don't need to be necessarily backported. It's better to do them only in major release (2.0). One of them is a step towards putting a better system in place (interactive/non-interactive compat, also discussed here).

Reverted those changes from branch-1.
Submitted patch to fix this issue in master.

Following output shows difference between interactive/non-interactive for a simple command like balance_switch.
Interactive

hbase(main):003:0> balance_switch true

Previous balancer state : true

Took 0.0210 seconds

hbase(main):004:0> balance_switch false

Previous balancer state : true

Took 0.0130 seconds

Non-interactive output. Note the last line returning raw (unformatted) output which in this case is simple true/false string.

~/apache/hbase  (HBASE-16044) → echo "balance_switch true" | ./bin/hbase shell -n

2016-06-28 18:23:12,930 WARN  [main] util.NativeCodeLoader: Unable to load native-hadoop library for your platform... using builtin-java classes where applicable

Previous balancer state : false

Took 0.3890 seconds

false

~/apache/hbase  (HBASE-16044) → echo "balance_switch true" | ./bin/hbase shell -n

2016-06-28 18:23:22,528 WARN  [main] util.NativeCodeLoader: Unable to load native-hadoop library for your platform... using builtin-java classes where applicable

Previous balancer state : true

Took 0.3830 seconds

true

-1 overall

The changes are in shell files so failures in last run can be safely ignored.
Ready for review.

So change is reverted for branch-1. What do you lads propose that we do on master ? Create patch for graceful_stop.sh and rolling restart now or revisit this issue when work around non-interactive hbase shell is completed ?
I posted a patch earlier. PTAL if it's satisfactory fix for this issue.
Samir Ahmic, does this look good to you?
+1. Appy mind putting same fix in rolling-restart.sh ?

Made the change which Samir Ahmic said. Ran TestShell locally (90 tests, 543 assertions, 0 failures, 3 errors), the 3 failures were because of HBASE-16184.
Pushing to master.
